bibl.title: Three Latin Business Documents from the Papyrussammlung of the Austrian National Library at Vienna (ChLA XLIV 1296; 1310; 1303 + XLV 1348)
bibl.note: 1. Acknowledgement of debt (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 70 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1296 descr.). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, early III AD. - 2. Legal contract in epistolary form (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 86 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1310 descr.). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, May, AD 206 or 227. - Some considerations on the form of the documents. - 3. Business document with a section in Greek (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 77 + 145 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1303 + XLV, 1348). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, AD 266. - A possible reconstruction of Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1303 + XLV, 1348.
bibl.seg: 141.5 Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1296 descr.; 1310 descr. 145.5 Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1303 + XLV, 1348
Giulio Iovine, Three Latin Business Documents from the Papyrussammlung of the Austrian National Library at Vienna (ChLA XLIV 1296; 1310; 1303 + XLV 1348).

1. Acknowledgement of debt (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 70 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1296 descr.). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, early III AD. - 2. Legal contract in epistolary form (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 86 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1310 descr.). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, May, AD 206 or 227. - Some considerations on the form of the documents. - 3. Business document with a section in Greek (P. Vindob. Lat. Inv. 77 + 145 = Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1303 + XLV, 1348). Arsinoites or Heracleopolites?, AD 266. - A possible reconstruction of Ch.L.A. XLIV, 1303 + XLV, 1348.
